name: Cross-Linking Between Categories
description: Check if the page includes links to other related categories and products
test_details:
Analyze the page to determine if it includes cross-links to other categories, related products, or complementary content areas.

Good cross-linking indicators:
- Links to related product categories
- "You might also like" or "Related products" sections
- Category navigation that's visible and accessible
- Breadcrumb navigation showing hierarchy
- Footer links to other main categories
- Internal links within content to related pages

Fail if:
- Page is isolated with no links to other content
- Only has external links
- No clear navigation to other sections

Pass if there's evidence of intentional cross-linking strategy.

name: Trust Building Elements
description: Verify appropriate trust signals like USPs, badges, guarantees, and value propositions
test_details:
Evaluate if the page contains sufficient trust-building elements to establish credibility.

Look for:
- Unique Selling Propositions (USPs)
- Trust badges (security, payment, certifications)
- Money-back guarantees or warranties
- Clear value propositions
- Customer testimonials or reviews
- Security seals
- Industry certifications or awards
- Free shipping/returns messaging
- "As seen in" logos
- Years in business or customer count

Pass if: Multiple trust elements are present (3+ different types)
Warning if: Only 1-2 trust elements found
Fail if: No clear trust signals visible

Consider the page type - homepage should have more than a basic content page.

name: Discounts and Promotions Featured
description: Check if the website highlights any discounts, sales, or promotional offers
test_details:
Determine if the page prominently features any discounts, sales, or promotional offers.

Look for:
- Percentage discounts (e.g., "20% off")
- Sale banners or promotional headers
- Promo code fields or callouts
- Limited-time offers
- Free shipping thresholds
- Bundle deals or package offers
- "Sale" or "Clearance" sections
- Countdown timers for offers
- Newsletter signup discounts
- First-time buyer discounts

Pass if: Clear promotional offers are featured
Not Applicable if: This appears to be a service/portfolio site where discounts wouldn't apply
Fail if: E-commerce site with no visible promotions

Note: Absence of promotions is not necessarily bad, but presence can boost conversion.

name: Subscription Offering
description: Check if the website offers subscription-based products or services
test_details:
Determine if the website offers subscription-based purchasing options.

Look for:
- "Subscribe and Save" options
- Monthly/annual subscription plans
- Membership programs
- Auto-delivery or recurring order options
- Subscription tiers (Basic, Premium, etc.)
- "Subscribe" CTAs or buttons
- Subscription management language
- Recurring billing mentions

Pass if: Clear subscription offerings are present
Not Applicable if: Business model doesn't support subscriptions (one-time service, portfolio site, etc.)
Fail if: E-commerce site that could benefit from subscriptions but doesn't offer them

Subscriptions can increase customer lifetime value significantly.

name: Cart Type - Flyout vs Standalone
description: Determine if the shopping cart is a flyout overlay or a standalone page
test_details:
Analyze the cart implementation to determine if it's a flyout (slide-out/overlay) or standalone page.

Flyout/Drawer cart indicators:
- Cart drawer or slide-out panel mentions in HTML
- Overlay or modal cart components
- "Add to cart" without full page navigation
- Mini-cart or cart preview functionality

Standalone page indicators:
- Dedicated /cart or /shopping-cart URLs
- Full-page cart experience
- Navigation takes users to separate cart page

Note: Flyout carts generally have higher conversion rates as they reduce friction and keep users in shopping mode. Standalone carts can work better for complex purchases.

Pass if: Implementation is clear and appropriate for the site type
Provide analysis of which type is detected and whether it suits the business model.

name: Blog and Educational Content
description: Check if the website features a blog or educational content section
test_details:
Determine if the website includes a blog or educational content to support SEO and customer education.

Look for:
- Blog section or blog link in navigation
- Article or news sections
- Resource center or knowledge base
- Guides, tutorials, or how-to content
- Case studies or success stories
- FAQ section with substantial content
- Video library or webinar content
- Whitepapers or downloadable resources

Pass if: Clear blog or educational content section exists
Warning if: Minimal educational content
Not Applicable if: Portfolio or personal site where blog isn't expected
Fail if: Business site with no content marketing strategy

Blogs and educational content are crucial for SEO, establishing authority, and nurturing leads.

name: Important Pages in Navigation
description: Verify that all critical pages are accessible from the main navigation
test_details:
Analyze the navigation structure to ensure all important pages are easily accessible.

For e-commerce sites, check for:
- Products/Shop
- About/About Us
- Contact
- Cart
- Account/Login
- FAQ/Help
- Shipping/Returns policies

For service sites, check for:
- Services
- About
- Contact
- Portfolio/Work/Case Studies
- Pricing (if applicable)
- Blog/Resources

For SaaS sites, check for:
- Features/Product
- Pricing
- Resources/Docs
- Login/Sign Up
- Contact/Support

Pass if: All expected pages for the site type are in navigation or clearly accessible
Warning if: 1-2 important pages are buried or missing
Fail if: Multiple critical pages are not easily accessible

Navigation should reflect the user's expected mental model.

name: URL Structure Hierarchy
description: Check if the URL structure reflects a clear, logical hierarchy
test_details:
Evaluate the URL structure to determine if it follows a logical, hierarchical pattern.

Good URL hierarchy examples:
- /category/subcategory/product
- /blog/category/post-title
- /products/category-name
- /services/service-type

Positive indicators:
- Clear categorization in URLs
- Readable, descriptive paths
- Consistent structure across similar pages
- Logical depth (not too flat, not too deep)
- Uses hyphens for word separation

Negative indicators:
- Random IDs or numbers in URLs
- Inconsistent structure
- URLs like /page?id=123
- Overly complex nested structures (5+ levels)
- Query parameters for main content

Pass if: URLs demonstrate clear hierarchy and organization
Warning if: Some inconsistencies but generally logical
Fail if: No apparent structure or logic

Good URL structure helps both SEO and user navigation.

name: Content Flow and Layout Balance
description: Evaluate if content flows well with appropriate imagery and avoids walls of text
test_details:
Assess whether the content and layout create good reading flow with appropriate visual balance.

Good flow indicators:
- Short paragraphs (2-4 sentences)
- Subheadings break up content sections
- Images interspersed throughout content
- White space between sections
- Mix of text and visual elements
- Lists or bullet points for scannability
- Clear visual hierarchy
- Appropriate image-to-text ratio for brand type

Warning signs:
- Large blocks of unbroken text (walls of text)
- No images or too few images
- Cluttered layout with no breathing room
- All text or all images
- Poor contrast or readability

Consider the brand type:
- Visual brands (fashion, photography): More images expected
- Service/B2B brands: More balanced text and visuals
- Content-heavy brands: Text-focused is acceptable if well-formatted

Pass if: Content flows naturally with appropriate visual balance
Warning if: Some sections have poor flow
Fail if: Significant walls of text or poor layout balance

name: Hero and Above-Fold Brand Clarity
description: Check if users can quickly understand what the brand does from hero and above-fold content
test_details:
Evaluate if the hero section and above-the-fold content clearly communicate what the brand/company does.

Clear messaging should include:
- Prominent headline stating what the company does or offers
- Value proposition visible immediately
- Clear categorization (e.g., "E-commerce Platform", "Web Design Agency")
- Supporting subheadline with more context
- Relevant hero image or illustration
- Clear call-to-action

Pass if: Within 5 seconds of viewing, it's obvious:
  1. What the company does/sells
  2. Who it's for
  3. What makes it valuable

Warning if: Takes some inference or reading to understand

Fail if:
- Generic messaging that could apply to any business
- No clear statement of purpose
- Confusing or vague headlines
- Hero doesn't reflect the business at all

The hero section is the most critical real estate - users should instantly understand if this site is relevant to them.

name: Upsell Opportunities
description: Check if the website implements upselling strategies to increase average order value
test_details:
Identify if the website includes upselling opportunities to maximize revenue per customer.

Upsell tactics to look for:
- "Frequently bought together" suggestions
- Product bundles or kits
- Volume discounts ("Buy 2, save 10%")
- Tiered pricing options
- Premium or upgraded versions
- Add-on products or services
- "Complete the look" suggestions
- Extended warranties or protection plans
- Gift wrapping or expedited shipping options
- Related/complementary product recommendations
- "Customers also bought" sections

Pass if: Multiple upsell mechanisms are present
Warning if: Only basic recommendations present
Not Applicable if: Site type doesn't support upselling (portfolio, service inquiry, etc.)
Fail if: E-commerce site with zero upsell strategy

Upselling can increase average order value by 10-30% when done thoughtfully.
